goodResponse.fullResponse:
✮ SCRIPTURE
John 3:16 - "For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life."

↗ Simple Explanation
• God's love for humanity motivated the ultimate sacrifice - sending Jesus
• "Whoever believes" means salvation is available to all people, not just a select few
• "Eternal life" refers to both quality and quantity - life with God forever

↗ Historical Context
• Written by John around 85-90 AD to Greek-speaking audience
• Part of Jesus' conversation with Nicodemus, a Jewish religious leader
• Cultural context: Jews believed salvation was only for their nation

↗ Theological Significance
• Central doctrine of substitutionary atonement - Jesus died in our place
• Demonstrates the Trinity - Father's love, Son's sacrifice, Spirit's work in belief
• Foundation of salvation by faith alone, not works

↗ Cross References
• Romans 5:8 - "God demonstrates his own love for us..."
• 1 John 4:9-10 - God's love shown through sending His Son
• Romans 6:23 - "The gift of God is eternal life..."
